newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Taechang up on N.Korea business news.
newsitem.headline: Taechang up on N.Korea business news.

text.p: Shares in Taechang Co rose to their daily limit in early afternoon trading on Friday on news that its application for a joint venture in North Korea had been approved, brokers said.
Taechang gained 2,500 won to 34,800. A unification ministry statement said Taechang planned to invest $5.8 million in the venture to bottle mineral water.
"The company has been widely expected to earn much from the project," said Hwang Chang-joong of LG Securities.
Taechang, South Korea's leading underwear maker, has sought to expand its business into the mineral water supply business.
A Taechang official said output from the North Korean venture would be mainly for consumption in South Korea.
The company will hold a 60 percent stake in the venture and a North Korean trading company the remainder, the ministry statement said.
